channel.title: Client version finder (written in clojure!)
channel.description:
trying to learn clojure, so i rewrote silab's client version finder in clojure.
i put this in the java section because clojure uses the java standard library, i demand a lisp section though
[code](import '(java.net Socket) '(java.io DataOutputStream DataInputStream))
(defn version-check [version] (let [sock (Socket. "world1.runescape.com" 43594) in (DataInputStream. (.getInputStream sock)) out (DataOutputStream. (.getOutputStream sock))] (doto out (.writeByte 15) (.writeShort 0) (.writeShort version) (.flush)) (.readByte in)))
(defn client-version [start max] (loop [current start] (if (or (= 0 (version-check current)) (= max current)) current (recur (inc current))))) [/code]
open up a repl in clojure, run by doing (for example): [code](client-version 520 535)[/code]
before it wouldnt exit the loop if it had hit the max argument, all fixed

item.title: Client version finder (written in clojure!)
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:4, topic:258933”]this clojure looks very nice, an epic combination.
I’m definatly going to have a look,

(defn version-check [version]

why are there square brackets? in cl they are just normal brackets.

[quote author=Cheese_Police link=topic=341913.msg2644648#msg2644648 date=1233129392]i demand a lisp section though
[/quote][/quote]

[] in clojure denotes a vector, and defn calls for a vector to declare a list of function parameters (well, defn is just a macro, fn is where it comes into play).

Read full topic

item.title: Client version finder (written in clojure!)
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

trying to learn clojure, so i rewrote silab’s client version finder in clojure.

i put this in the java section because clojure uses the java standard library, i demand a lisp section though

[code](import '(java.net Socket) '(java.io DataOutputStream DataInputStream))

(defn version-check [version]
(let [sock (Socket. “world1.runescape.com” 43594)
in (DataInputStream. (.getInputStream sock))
out (DataOutputStream. (.getOutputStream sock))]
(doto out
(.writeByte 15)
(.writeShort 0)
(.writeShort version)
(.flush))
(.readByte in)))

(defn client-version [start max]
(loop [current start]
(if (or (= 0 (version-check current)) (= max current))
current
(recur (inc current)))))
[/code]

open up a repl in clojure, run by doing (for example):

(client-version 520 535)

before it wouldnt exit the loop if it had hit the max argument, all fixed

Read full topic
